>
[Mature Animal Companion (Ranger)](/Feats.aspx?ID=4879) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Ranger" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=682" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 159 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Archetype** [Wylderheart](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=318) (Level 6)

**Prerequisites**
[Animal Companion](/Feats.aspx?ID=4708)

</column>

---

Your animal companion becomes a mature animal companion and gains [additional capabilities](/Rules.aspx?ID=2117).

Your animal companion has greater independence. During an encounter, even if you don’t use the Command an Animal action, your animal companion can still use 1 action that round on your turn to Stride or Strike. It can do this at any point during your turn, as long as you aren’t currently taking an action. If it does, that’s all the actions it gets that round—you can’t Command it later.

<title level="2">Mature Animal Companion (Ranger) leads to...</title>
[Incredible Companion (Ranger)](/Feats.aspx?ID=4888)
